Viserys declared Dany like Princes Of the Dragonstone

Jon is a legirimate son of Rhaegar. Son of Princes of Dragonstone.

Dany is a Princess who was born for Jon.

Dany was born in her home. Jon is her home.

Because of that she said “I am here but I’m not feel like home”

Because Jon wasn’t there.

When Dany thinks about red door and lemon tree she felt home. Lemon comes only in Dorne . And Jon was born in Dorne

tags: GoT could have handled a bit more of Ygritte's duality now that i think about it
summary: Warning - Ramble:  I’m not trying to be an Ygritte apologist here; I understand her coercion and disrespect for Jon’s consent...
body:
Warning - Ramble: 

I’m not trying to be an Ygritte apologist here; I understand her coercion and disrespect for Jon’s consent was wrong but the impact she had on his narrative was incredible to watch unfold every time. And while I don’t think Jon and her would have remained partners for long at all in any other AU circumstance, but it’s easy to see how some parts of him grew to care for her so deeply. Sure, people remember she was fierce and brave and good with a bow, but they often overlook how determined she was in her cause to survive, how she liked to sing and the thought of giants going extinct brought tears to her eyes. 

I see us demonize or purify all these characters so aggressively sometimes it’s easy to forget the good and the bad and the canon tbh

summary: Does Jon get Ghost in the King's Landing AU?
question: Does Jon get Ghost in the King's Landing AU?
answer:
Yes. On his one and only visit to Winterfell he is given Ghost as a gift when the children come across the direwolves. Eddard thinks that perhaps giving Jon a symbol of their house will make him feel more welcome, but being given the runt that could likely die is seen by many as an insult and a threat from Eddard for Jon to keep away from Winterfell.

Ghost flourishes in King’s Landing and is the darling of the court for his proper behavior and beautiful white fur. He is always at Jon’s side and has a very fancy collar that was a gift from Queen Rhaenys. 

Thanks for the ask!

summary: Thank you for answering my questions about Jon! But I was thinking that people would find strange that a bastard kept as hostage...
question: Thank you for answering my questions about Jon! But I was thinking that people would find strange that a bastard kept as hostage be legitimized. What would be the reason of the legitimization? And why take a bastard when there is a true born son available?
answer:
It’s no problem at all, I love answering all these questions.

Legitimizing a bastard isn’t that uncommon, and it is never specified in Winterfell WHOSE son he is. I don’t think Jon’s visit to Winterfell is seen as something very auspicious. It isn’t a welcoming home of a lost son so much as the return of a mystery that most of the North knows they’re not allowed to answer. Rumors abound as to whose son he is: Ned’s? Benjen’s? The son of the deceased Brandon Stark and the TRUE heir to Winterfell? Perhaps that was the reason he was so easily given up by Eddard, if he believed his own right to the seat of Winterfell was threatened.

And Lord Tywin likes this rumor, that he is actually Brandon Stark’s heir. It means that if ever Eddard Stark disobeys, Tywin has someone he can use as leverage in a very different way. He could sit a puppet of the throne as the legitimate heir of Winterfell and many would believe it was the right and proper thing to do.

And Jon is treated well. VERY well. Far better in this AU then he is treated as a bastard of Ned Stark by Catelyn in the books. He is fawned over by his nursemaids at Casterly Rock, and then he is a favored playmate of Prince Aegon and treated well by the nobility that wish favor with Tywin Lannister and Queen Rhaenys, who also seems to enjoy Jon’s company. 

The little part of Jon that grows up feeling out of place, like he isn’t wanted as a Stark, is a part of him that Tywin manipulates by making him think it’s because he’s a true heir and was given over by his Uncle so that Ned Stark could have the North. So Jon’s gloominess is still there, but it hides a far different hurt, and one borne of resentment. He definitely feels more at place in King’s Landing where people like him, than he does when he visits Winterfell once and sees strangers that walk around him like he’s made of glass and whisper when he walks by. 

Thanks for the ask!

tags: TO MAKE A LIE SOUND LIKE THE TRUTH
summary: ON JON BENDING THE KNEE: THE BOAT SCENE
title: ON JON BENDING THE KNEE: THE BOAT SCENE
body:
I already talked about it a bit here, but this is one of those moments in SEASON 7 that got me screaming joyfully, so I’d like to try to explain to you why.

It begins with a very meaningful parallel with Ned and Cersei: in S01E06 Ned wakes up injured in bed with Cersei’s face staring at him. This is the first time Ned meets her after he found out about Robert’s bastards, and we know that the secret TRUTH OF WHO IS JOFFREY’S REAL FATHER is hanging between them, her role as his antagonist sealed.

From now on every decision Ned takes will be the wrong one: Cersei tells him “IN THE GAME OF THRONES YOU WIN OR YOU DIE. THERE’S NO MIDDLE GROUND” but the MADNESS OF his MERCY gives her the upper hand to win; he refuses her advances and openly defies her, like a not POLITICALNED; he doesn’t listen to Renly who suggests the not honorable but efficient route and relies on Littlefinger, who he trusts; he doesn’t trust Sansa enough to tell her the TRUTH; he doesn’t at least PRETEND to bend the knee to Joffrey while he can, he waits till he’s forced to, his fate already determined and a public display required.

As you can see, Jon and Ned’s paths are very similar, only their decisions are the opposite: while Ned plays Ned and loses, Jon politically watches, learns and acts… and wins a ticket back home!

So, what happens on the boat? To be concise, Jon wakes up and says to Daenerys “I’M SORRY, I’M SO SORRY” and takes her hand, she gives her word to help with the NK and he calls her “DANY” and then “MY QUEEN”. It could seem an intimate moment between two people destined to come together and save the world… but of course there’s more, and the parallel we’ve been introduced with should be enough to anticipate it:

- “DANY”: this is not a term of endearment to her, so much so that she remembers that it was her not so loving brother who called her that, adding: “NOT THE COMPANY YOU WANT TO KEEP”. This is a warning for us;

-“MY QUEEN”: Let’s not overlook the obvious, he doesn’t really call her that, he only asks “HOW ABOUT MY QUEEN?” It’s not the same. This is no pledge whatsoever;

- “I’D BEND THE KNEE BUT …”: to follow up on the previous point, Jon does not actually bend the knee! By now “EVERYTHING BEFORE THE WORD BUT IS HORSESHIT” has become such a mantra that we all understand how important that BUT is, and we can’t ignore either that his knee doesn’t bend especially after the numerous times we’ve been shown what a solemn moment that is, this season too with Sansa and Jon miniatures;

- “WE’RE GOING TO DESTROY THE KNIGHT KING AND HIS ARMY, WE’LL DO IT TOGETHER”: because she has already promised her help, some of you say this is the biggest clue that Jon is not lying, that he doesn’t need to. But is it so? He saw how much she wants the IT, don’t you think there’s a possibility she said that just because she’s hurting for her loss? Jon said to Sansa “IF YOU HAD SEEN THE NK YOU’D THINK OF LITTLE ELSE”, Dany says “YOU HAVE TOO SEE IT TO KNOW”. So now she knows the danger. But if she does intend to go help the North why are they sailing to KL? It necessarily means that her help is still conditional on the ceasefire, right? So, let’s say that Cersei in the Pit refuses, what would happen next? Actually I think Jon has really no hope for the truce, how could he when Sansa talked to him about Cersei and he’s already observed Dany’s pride and volatility? It’s true, in this precise moment she isn’t asking him to bend the knee, but is she done expecting it? There are too many incognita to be sure of anything, so it makes sense that Jon decides to go with the clever plan: if he pretends only to bend the knee, with no witness, without actually swearing an oath, without physically bending, when she’s not asking, while she is emotionally distressed and he’s stuck in bed, doesn’t he have a better chance to pull it off? If she believes he’s surrendered the North to her, which she’s being demanding forever, plus her feelings for him which he’s aware of by now, doesn’t he have more chances to keep her invested even if they will be “fucked” in the Pit? Maybe prevent her from DRACARYS OMNIA too? And look how touched she is. I’d say he nailed it one episode early…;

-“AND THOSE WHO SWORE ALLEGIANCE TO YOU?”: and we’re immediately reminded that there should be a swearing. But nobody SWORE here! And to twist the knife further, this happens only few minutes after Brienne says to Sansa “I SWORE AN OATH TO PROTECT YOU AND YOUR SISTER”. Still, no swearing on the boat… at least not an oath;

- “YOU DO”: both the actor and the director seem to point out that Jon is lying, not only because this moment is a nice remainder of Bran in the pilot, but because in cinematography this is how you film someone who has something to hide or who’s lying;

- “THEY’LL COME TO SEE YOU FOR WHAT YOU ARE”: it becomes almost ominous with the song “WHAT YOU ARE” as background music, and you find yourself wondering WHAT she is;

- THE HAND HOLDING: As much as it’s true that Jon is the first to take her hand, the point is not what he does (though it’s worth noting that when Sansa did this he couldn’t say no to her) but what she does, which is to let go of his hand only to take it back later. In storytelling this is a way to show a TRUST SHIFT: when she first takes her hand away it means she doesn’t feel comfortable, she still doesn’t trust him completely and wants to keep control. Remember that in the show, even more in the books, she’s been warned more than once not to trust people, “BECAUSE DRAGONS ARE FIRE MADE FLESH AND FIRE IS POWER”. But after “MY QUEEN” she is the one to hold his hand saying “TOGETHER”, and you realize she’s just gave in and let herself go. CHECK AND MATE!

- JON PRETENDS TO SLEEP: when he closes his eyes and she goes out, you cannot help but thinking about “THE COMPANY YOU WANT TO KEEP”;

- THE BREATHING: As soon as she is out, Jon breathes deeply, feeling the weight of what’s just happened, and probably the guilt too. But he also looks upwards.

KH is very attentive to these little things, particularly this season (which is significant in itself, if you then read his interviews I’d say it’s all very transparent), which means he’s telling us something more, and I believe it’s the plainest: he’s thinking about Ned, probably asking forgiveness for not being honorable like he taught him. Jon is pretending to do something that de facto he doesn’t do. He’s very consciously misleading her, walking that fine line between what you say and what you mean. Clever, but not exactly honorable.

That’s it for the analysis, but let’s clutch at straws and say we’re still not convinced… Well, I’ve saved my favorite part for the end, namely the reason for my screaming in the first place.

We need to look back at the previous scene between Arya and Sansa because D&D often handle consecutive scenes purposefully linking them to add meaning, and right here we have one of the best examples.

In Arya’s room in search of the scroll, Sansa finds her faces and asks her about it. Arya says: “THERE WAS A GAME I USED TO PLAY. THE GAME OF FACES. IT’S SIMPLE. I ASK A QUESTION ABOUT YOURSELF AND YOU TRY TO MAKE A LIE SOUND LIKE THE TRUTH. IF YOU FOOL ME, YOU WIN. IF I CATCH A LIE, YOU LOSE. LET’S PLAY… ALL I NEED TO FIND OUT IS YOUR FACE”

Following shot: 

BINGO! 

Why should they give us a close-up on Jon’s face if not so we can ask ourselves what face he is wearing? Is he wearing one at all? Why would he wear one? Does he need to? But if Jon is not wearing any face, why should we wonder if he’s wearing a face? Then why giving us this hint? Only to trick us? But if they only want to play tricksy with us, why didn’t they let us be oblivious to the trick without tying the two scenes?

BECAUSE JON IS WEARING NOT HIS TRUE FACE! That’s why!

JON WINS THE GAME OF FACES!

Thank you for listening!

THERE’S NO MIDDLE GROUND” but the MADNESS OF his MERCY gives her the upper hand to win; he refuses her advances and openly defies her, like a not POLITICALNED; he doesn’t listen to Renly who suggests the not honorable but efficient route and relies on Littlefinger, who he trusts; he doesn’t trust Sansa enough to tell her the TRUTH; he doesn’t at least PRETEND to bend the knee to Joffrey while he can, he waits till he’s forced to, his fate already determined and a public display required.

As you can see, Jon and Ned’s paths are very similar, only their decisions are the opposite: while Ned plays Ned and loses, Jon politically watches, learns and acts… and wins a ticket back home!

So, what happens on the boat? To be concise, Jon wakes up and says to Daenerys “I’M SORRY, I’M SO SORRY” and takes her hand, she gives her word to help with the NK and he calls her “DANY” and then “MY QUEEN”. It could seem an intimate moment between two people destined to come together and save the world… but of course there’s more, and the parallel we’ve been introduced with should be enough to anticipate it:

- “DANY”: this is not a term of endearment to her, so much so that she remembers that it was her not so loving brother who called her that, adding: “NOT THE COMPANY YOU WANT TO KEEP”. This is a warning for us;

-“MY QUEEN”: Let’s not overlook the obvious, he doesn’t really call her that, he only asks “HOW ABOUT MY QUEEN?” It’s not the same. This is no pledge whatsoever;

- “I’D BEND THE KNEE BUT …”: to follow up on the previous point, Jon does not actually bend the knee! By now “EVERYTHING BEFORE THE WORD BUT IS HORSESHIT” has become such a mantra that we all understand how important that BUT is, and we can’t ignore either that his knee doesn’t bend especially after the numerous times we’ve been shown what a solemn moment that is, this season too with Sansa and Jon miniatures;

- “WE’RE GOING TO DESTROY THE KNIGHT KING AND HIS ARMY, WE’LL DO IT TOGETHER”: because she has already promised her help, some of you say this is the biggest clue that Jon is not lying, that he doesn’t need to. But is it so? He saw how much she wants the IT, don’t you think there’s a possibility she said that just because she’s hurting for her loss? Jon said to Sansa “IF YOU HAD SEEN THE NK YOU’D THINK OF LITTLE ELSE”, Dany says “YOU HAVE TOO SEE IT TO KNOW”. So now she knows the danger. But if she does intend to go help the North why are they sailing to KL? It necessarily means that her help is still conditional on the ceasefire, right? So, let’s say that Cersei in the Pit refuses, what would happen next? Actually I think Jon has really no hope for the truce, how could he when Sansa talked to him about Cersei and he’s already observed Dany’s pride and volatility? It’s true, in this precise moment she isn’t asking him to bend the knee, but is she done expecting it? There are too many incognita to be sure of anything, so it makes sense that Jon decides to go with the clever plan: if he pretends only to bend the knee, with no witness, without actually swearing an oath, without physically bending, when she’s not asking, while she is emotionally distressed and he’s stuck in bed, doesn’t he have a better chance to pull it off? If she believes he’s surrendered the North to her, which she’s being demanding forever, plus her feelings for him which he’s aware of by now, doesn’t he have more chances to keep her invested even if they will be “fucked” in the Pit? Maybe prevent her from DRACARYS OMNIA too? And look how touched she is. I’d say he nailed it one episode early…;

-“AND THOSE WHO SWORE ALLEGIANCE TO YOU?”: and we’re immediately reminded that there should be a swearing. But nobody SWORE here! And to twist the knife further, this happens only few minutes after Brienne says to Sansa “I SWORE AN OATH TO PROTECT YOU AND YOUR SISTER”. Still, no swearing on the boat… at least not an oath;

- “YOU DO”: both the actor and the director seem to point out that Jon is lying, not only because this moment is a nice remainder of Bran in the pilot, but because in cinematography this is how you film someone who has something to hide or who’s lying;

- “THEY’LL COME TO SEE YOU FOR WHAT YOU ARE”: it becomes almost ominous with the song “WHAT YOU ARE” as background music, and you find yourself wondering WHAT she is;

- THE HAND HOLDING: As much as it’s true that Jon is the first to take her hand, the point is not what he does (though it’s worth noting that when Sansa did this he couldn’t say no to her) but what she does, which is to let go of his hand only to take it back later. In storytelling this is a way to show a TRUST SHIFT: when she first takes her hand away it means she doesn’t feel comfortable, she still doesn’t trust him completely and wants to keep control. Remember that in the show, even more in the books, she’s been warned more than once not to trust people, “BECAUSE DRAGONS ARE FIRE MADE FLESH AND FIRE IS POWER”. But after “MY QUEEN” she is the one to hold his hand saying “TOGETHER”, and you realize she’s just gave in and let herself go. CHECK AND MATE!

- JON PRETENDS TO SLEEP: when he closes his eyes and she goes out, you cannot help but thinking about “THE COMPANY YOU WANT TO KEEP”;

- THE BREATHING: As soon as she is out, Jon breathes deeply, feeling the weight of what’s just happened, and probably the guilt too. But he also looks upwards.

KH is very attentive to these little things, particularly this season (which is significant in itself, if you then read his interviews I’d say it’s all very transparent), which means he’s telling us something more, and I believe it’s the plainest: he’s thinking about Ned, probably asking forgiveness for not being honorable like he taught him. Jon is pretending to do something that de facto he doesn’t do. He’s very consciously misleading her, walking that fine line between what you say and what you mean. Clever, but not exactly honorable.

That’s it for the analysis, but let’s clutch at straws and say we’re still not convinced… Well, I’ve saved my favorite part for the end, namely the reason for my screaming in the first place.

We need to look back at the previous scene between Arya and Sansa because D&D often handle consecutive scenes purposefully linking them to add meaning, and right here we have one of the best examples.

In Arya’s room in search of the scroll, Sansa finds her faces and asks her about it. Arya says: “THERE WAS A GAME I USED TO PLAY. THE GAME OF FACES. IT’S SIMPLE. I ASK A QUESTION ABOUT YOURSELF AND YOU TRY TO MAKE A LIE SOUND LIKE THE TRUTH. IF YOU FOOL ME, YOU WIN. IF I CATCH A LIE, YOU LOSE. LET’S PLAY… ALL I NEED TO FIND OUT IS YOUR FACE”

Following shot: 

BINGO! 

Why should they give us a close-up on Jon’s face if not so we can ask ourselves what face he is wearing? Is he wearing one at all? Why would he wear one? Does he need to? But if Jon is not wearing any face, why should we wonder if he’s wearing a face? Then why giving us this hint? Only to trick us? But if they only want to play tricksy with us, why didn’t they let us be oblivious to the trick without tying the two scenes?

BECAUSE JON IS WEARING NOT HIS TRUE FACE! That’s why!

JON WINS THE GAME OF FACES!

Thank you for listening!

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: I’ve never really understood as to why it’s never acknowledged that the Tarlys committed treason by betraying Olenna Tyrell and...
body:
I’ve never really understood as to why it’s never acknowledged that the Tarlys committed treason by betraying Olenna Tyrell and fighting a whole ass war against Daenerys. People saying they didn’t deserve to be killed and shit like that but the punishment for treason has always been death. People even say that Jon Snow would never yet the punishment for treason in the north is also death.

Just a thought.

blog.description: Everything before the word 'but' is horse shit. - Jon Snow

summary: BEYOND THE WALL
body:
BEYOND THE WALL

I just realised that as soon as Dany left Jon’s room after he “bent the knee”, Jon actually sighed quite uneasily (S07E06). Like, yeah. He wasn’t supposed to bend the knee without consulting anyone. But in my POV, Jon felt the need. After all, Dany somehow saved the squad from the White Walkers. So, Jon felt that they were in Dany’s debt for her help. To be honest, without Dany’s dragons, the squad would’ve been dead. No chance of survival at all. At the same time, Jon took the chance to “bend the knee” because:

  • Dany promised him that they would fight against the White Walkers together, since
  • She wanted to avenge Viserion’s death at the same time
  • Her focus on the subject was on point - right at that particular moment

And I can’t help but to also think that Jon bent the knee out of a tinge of sympathy when Dany showed her sorrow towards Viserion’s death.

summary: How do you think Jon is going to react to his birth name being Aegon Targaryen? What do you think that being his name means and...
question: How do you think Jon is going to react to his birth name being Aegon Targaryen? What do you think that being his name means and how will the resolution to that tie into Jon’s overall view of his identity in Season 8?
answer:
Hey anon,

I’ve been asked many times about the revelation of Jon’s parentage, you can find examples of these here, here, here, here, here and here. Regarding his name being Aegon, (I’m still not crazy about it but c'est la vie) it’s going to be shocking, frankly, finding out his “real” name isn’t Jon would be shocking no matter what his real name might be. I do think the fact that he has another name will be the least shocking thing about that entire revelation. Learning who his parents are is the real shocker there. 

The show included a scene last season where Jon tells Thyon that he doesn’t have to choose between being a Greyjoy and a Stark, that he can embrace both. I think this is clearly foreshadowing where Jon is going to end up in season 8. More likely than not it’ll be Dany who says this to Jon, as she seems to repeat back to him things he has said to other people in the past, sometimes verbatim. He’ll come to terms with it, there’s nothing to be done, it is what it is. 

Personally, I don’t think he’ll change his name. He had the chance to become a Stark, something he’s wanted his whole life, and he turned that down, I think we’ll see something similar next season. Jon Snow is such an iconic name, I have a really hard time seeing it get changed. Who knows what will happen, but that’s how I see it. 

TTFN

summary:
Stay Awhile
Chapter Two: Honey fingers — a preview:
‘Jon snapped the scrunchie against his wrist, reassuring her that it wasn’t...
body:
Stay Awhile

Chapter Two: Honey fingers — a preview:

‘Jon snapped the scrunchie against his wrist, reassuring her that it wasn’t going anywhere. “I won’t. Now pass over your phone.”

“Why?” she asked tartly, her nerves wearing down on her patience for this whole thing.

“Don’t you trust me?” Jon gave her a pointed look. Sighing, she reached inside her clutch and handed over her phone for him. He opened the camera app, pulled a face imitating the puppy dog look and took a photo. “Alright,” he said, handing back her phone, “you need to make this your background. It’s relationship one-oh-one.”

“And what’s your new background?”

He looked affronted by her question. “Dany, c’mon, you know I already got it.” He pulled out his phone to show her the lock screen, which was a picture of her he had taken just a moment ago.

Checksmate, Targaryen.’

Chapter Two is now up on Ao3!

summary:
As the thunder rolled on, Jon
scooted closer on the couch. His arm wrapped around you while his other hand
reached for the...
caption:
As the thunder rolled on, Jon scooted closer on the couch. His arm wrapped around you while his other hand reached for the popcorn. You helped him by putting the bowl closer for his reach.

“Aren’t you glad you called off today?” you smiled at him. Jon kept on watching the television. He stopped eating the popcorn.

“Where is her mother?” He pointed to a character on the tv.

“She doesn’t have one. The government kidnapped her,” you explained. “Don’t you remember? Hawkins lab?” Jon nodded and continued to snuggle and watch Netflix with you.

summary:
[[MORE]] Repost from @ertacaltinoz - "Kissed by Fire" by me.
Surprise surprise!
Yes, I believe there's a good chance Tormund has...
caption:
Repost from @ertacaltinoz - “Kissed by Fire” by me.
Surprise surprise!
Yes, I believe there’s a good chance Tormund has already died at that time the wall fell down. :)
You know, tv show mostly continued from where it left with it’s last scene in previous episode. And I think the aftermath at the wall is probably the first thing they’re going to show with the opening of Season Eight.
According to this image, the wall by the EastWatch is destroyed, whole wight army has already passed through it. Maybe one or two wights are lingering around before joining the rest. And then we see a movement beneath the snow. A hand appears, and then the whole body comes out between snowy ice blocks. Seeing his back, we immediately realize it’s Tormund. He looks like he is devastated, his shoulders are down. He stumbles a couple of steps towards the wights which passed the wall just recently. Then camera pans and shows his face and his eyes… And the opening rolls with iconic main title theme ! ;)
I think there is no better way to start the very last season of Game of Thrones. What is better for showrunners than ruining our hopes by breaking our hearths with a most loved character’s loss from the very first scene? I guess no one can deny Tormund is one of symbols of mankind’s faith and hope for the future since he has a dream of having giant babies from his true love -lady Brienne of Tarth
.
Now, please don’t judge me. I’m already gambling huge here. :P
On the other hand, I just couldn’t deform Tormund much -he still looks great despite of that long fall- since I have a huge respect for Kristofer Hivju.
Let’s wait and see what is really happening on tv.
Hopefully he survived and he is on his way back to Castle Black or to Winterfell?

Valar Morghulis everyone!
#GOT #gameofthrones

summary: A Confederacy of Stewards
body:
A Confederacy of Stewards

This theory basically explain that maybe Jon had been drugged before his murder, which could explain why his behavior was so strange.

Also in it there is at some point a link to ANOTHER theory that explain… that maybe the wildings are actually seeing Jon as Val’s husband. I know it sound weird but I read it anf it could explain a lot, especially why at some point Val come back to the Wall dressed in white.

It’s honestly mind blowing.
